intro: Actinella rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's actinella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
